intro: Poterium obscurum, commonly known as the darkleaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green in color. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered together. The berries it bears are usually red or orange, and they contain the seeds that are dispersed by birds.
